title: Passphrase given during HD-wallet creation is not used.  Empty string is used for HD-wallet operations.
body:
# üêû Bug Report

If you create a HD wallet, you are asked for a passphrase.  Regardless of what you choose, you can access the wallet using whatever passphrase you please.

### Description

Create HD wallet with passphrase1
Then run accounts-v2 create using passphrase2 <-- No issues
Repeat prior step with a set of random passphrases <-- No issues
List accounts, also no issue.

This stems from the following code in validator/keymanager/v2/derived/derived.go at lines 103 and 134:

```
	if !fileutil.FileExists(filepath.Join(cfg.Wallet.AccountsDir(), EncryptedSeedFileName)) {
		seedConfig, err := initializeWalletSeedFile(cfg.WalletPassword, cfg.SkipMnemonicConfirm)
		if err != nil {
			return nil, errors.Wrap(err, "could not initialize new wallet seed file")
		}
```

```
	decryptor := keystorev4.New()
	seed, err := decryptor.Decrypt(seedConfig.Crypto, cfg.WalletPassword)
	if err != nil {
		return nil, errors.Wrap(err, "could not decrypt seed configuration with password")
	}
```

**cfg.WalletPassword is being passed without being initialized.  The password obtained during startup would actually be in cfg.Wallet.walletPassword** obtainable using a getter method.

### Has this worked before in a previous version?

I don't know.  It might be the first time I have used Prysm HD wallets.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

See above

## üî• Error

See above

## üåç  Your Environment

Bug is in both in Windows 10 as well as Ubuntu running in docker running in Ubuntu VM.  64 bit.

**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)**

Current master.  acddb6035a2f07a8d4f38731c89778e7b1813afc

**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**
No
